chunks.text: ### Requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver
chunks.summary: This section applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers seeking immigration rights. It requires proof of authorized service and fulfillment of specific military exit conditions. Exceptions may apply based on the nature and length of service.

metadata.section_title: Application process for HM Armed Forces service leavers

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for an application as an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 1.1. If applying from outside the UK, the applicant must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “VAF AF”.

AF 1.2. If applying from in the UK, the applicant must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “SET(AF)”.

1.   AF 1.3. An application must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any required fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics, when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document which satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF 1.4. The applicant must be aged 18 or over on the date of application.

AF 1.5. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK on the date of application.

AF 1.6. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers applying for permission to stay. Applicants must apply online via specified forms (VAF AF from outside the UK and SET(AF) from within), pay fees, provide biometrics and identity documents, be aged 18 or over, and be present in the UK if applying to stay. Applications failing these validity criteria will be rejected.

metadata.section_title: Suitability requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 2.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant should not be refused under Part Suitability.

1.   AF 2.2 If the applicant is in the UK on the date of application, they must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers applying for UK immigration. Applicants must not be in breach of immigration laws (excluding certain overstays) or on bail at the time of application. The decision-maker must ensure these suitability criteria are met.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirements for HM Armed Forces

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirements for HM Armed Forces

AF 3.1. For the purpose of this Appendix, “HM Armed Forces” means Regular service personnel in the Royal Navy, the Royal Marines, the Army (including the Brigade of Gurkhas) and the Royal Air Force, and does not include the Reserve forces.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to Regular service personnel in the HM Armed Forces (Royal Navy, Marines, Army, RAF). It outlines eligibility criteria for inclusion, specifically excluding Reserve forces. No additional conditions or thresholds are specified.

metadata.section_title: Entry requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 4.1. An applicant seeking to come to the UK must apply for and obtain entry clearance as a HM Armed Forces service leaver before they arrive in the UK.

AF 4.2. An applicant must, if Appendix Tuberculosis applies, provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: HM Armed Forces service leavers must obtain entry clearance before arriving in the UK; if applicable, they must also provide a medical certificate confirming they have been screened for tuberculosis with no active disease.

metadata.section_title: Military Service requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Military Service requirements for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 5.1. The applicant must have: 
    1.   (a) completed at least 4 years’ reckonable service in HM Armed Forces; or
    2.   (b) met the medical discharge requirement in AF 6.1. or AF 6.2.

1.   AF 5.2. “Reckonable service” means service which counts towards an applicant’s pension, and it starts from the first day of paid service in HM Armed Forces, if over 18 on that date, or from their 18th birthday, but does not include time when the applicant is: 
    1.   (a) absent without leave (AWOL); or
    2.   (b) detained in military detention; or
    3.   (c) detained and serving a sentence in one of His Majesty’s Prisons (HMP), Young Offenders Institutions (YOI) or Youth Justice Board establishments (YJB); or
    4.   (d) on a career break; or
    5.   (e) on special unpaid leave, or
    6.   (f) on a career intermission; or
    7.   (g) on secondment; or
    8.   (h) on additional maternity leave or adoption leave over 40 weeks; or
    9.   (i) on additional shared parental leave over 40 weeks; or
    10.   (j) on unpaid parental leave.

1.   AF 5.3. On the date of application: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must be within 18 weeks of their discharge date; or
    2.   (b) the applicant must have been discharged from HM Armed Forces for less than 2 years; or
    3.   (c) in the case of an applicant who was medically discharged more than 2 years before the date of application, new information regarding their medical prognosis is being considered by the decision maker; or
    4.   (d) the applicant must have last been granted entry clearance or permission to stay as an HM Armed Forces service leaver.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers seeking immigration benefits. Applicants must have completed at least 4 years of reckonable service or been medically discharged, and be within 18 weeks of discharge or discharged within the past two years. Reckonable service excludes periods of AWOL, detention, or special leave.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix HM Armed Forces
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix HM Armed Forces
metadata.section_title: Medical discharge requirement for a HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Medical discharge requirement for a HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 6.1. The medical discharge requirement for settlement as an HM Armed Forces service leaver is met if the applicant has been medically discharged from HM Armed Forces and either: 
    1.   (a) the cause of the medical discharge was attributable to deployment on operations; or
    2.   (b) the cause of medical discharge was attributable to service and it is appropriate to grant settlement following consideration of: 
        1.   (i) the seriousness of the illness or injury; and
        2.   (ii) the need for further medical treatment in relation to the illness or injury and the availability of such medical treatment in the applicant’s country of origin; and
        3.   (iii) the prognosis for recovery, including whether the injury or illness will affect the applicant’s ability to support themselves in their country of origin; and
        4.   (iv) the length of reckonable service in HM Armed Forces at the time of the applicant’s medical discharge.

1.   AF 6.2. The medical discharge requirement for permission to stay as an HM Armed Forces service leaver is met if AF 6.1. does not apply, but the applicant has been medically discharged from service in HM Armed Forces, and: 
    1.   (a) the cause of the medical discharge was attributable to service in HM Armed Forces; and
    2.   (b) before they can return to their country of origin it is appropriate to grant permission to stay to facilitate: 
        1.   (i) further medical treatment; or
        2.   (ii) a period of recovery before they can travel.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers seeking settlement or permission to stay. It requires the applicant to be medically discharged due to deployment-related or service-related reasons, considering factors like illness severity, treatment needs, prognosis, and length of service. Exceptions apply if discharge is not attributable to service or deployment, or if specific conditions are unmet.

metadata.source: Immigration Rules Appendix HM Armed Forces
metadata.part: Immigration Rules Appendix HM Armed Forces
metadata.section_title: Decision on an application as an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application as an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 7.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that the validity, suitability and eligibility requirements for settlement as an HM Armed Forces service leaver are met, the applicant will be granted settlement.

AF 7.2. If the decision maker is satisfied that the validity, suitability, and eligibility requirements for permission to stay, but not settlement, as an Armed Forces service leaver, are met, the applicant will be granted permission to stay.

AF 7.3. If the decision maker is not satisfied that the applicant meets the suitability and eligibility requirements for settlement or permission to stay the application will be refused.

AF 7.4. If the application is refused the applicant can apply for an Administrative Review under Appendix Administrative Review.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers applying for settlement or permission to stay. It requires the decision maker to assess eligibility, suitability, and validity, granting settlement if all are met, permission if only some are met, or refusing if requirements are not satisfied. Applicants may request an Administrative Review if refused.

metadata.section_title: Period and conditions of grant for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Period and conditions of grant for an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 8.1. Where the decision is to grant permission to stay, the applicant will be granted permission to stay for a period not exceeding 30 months and will be subject to such conditions as to work, study and access to public funds as the decision maker considers appropriate.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to HM Armed Forces service leavers granted permission to stay. They may be authorized to remain for up to 30 months, subject to conditions regarding work, study, and public funds as determined by the decision maker.

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 9.1. If applying from outside the UK for entry clearance as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver, the applicant must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form “VAF AF”.

AF 9.2. If applying from in the UK for permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver, the applicant must apply on the gov.uk website on the specified form: “Further leave to remain – Armed Forces”.

1.   AF 9.3. An application as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any required fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document that satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF 9.4. An applicant applying for permission to stay must be in the UK on the date of application.

AF 9.5. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or of an HM Armed Forces service leaver may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants applying from outside or inside the UK as partners or children of HM Armed Forces members or leavers must submit online applications on specified forms, ensuring all validity requirements—fee payment, biometrics, identity documents, and UK presence at application—are met; failure to do so may result in rejection.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 12.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person where that person: 
    1.   (a) is a member of HM Armed Forces who is exempt from immigration control; or
    2.   (b) is at the same time applying for (and is being granted) permission to stay or settlement as a HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    3.   (c) has permission granted under this Appendix or the previous Appendix Armed Forces; or
    4.   (d) is a British citizen, including one who naturalised after 5 years reckonable service, who is a member of HM Armed Forces or is an HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    5.   (e) is settled providing the person had permission (or exemption from control) as a member of HM Armed Forces or as an HM Armed Forces service leaver before they were granted settlement.

AF 12.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.

The applicant must demonstrate a genuine relationship with a qualifying individual, such as a military member exempt from immigration control, a service leaver, or a British citizen linked to the armed forces, meeting specific relationship requirements and conditions outlined in the Appendix.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 13.1. If the application is for entry clearance and the applicant is a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner: 
    1.   (a) the applicant and their fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner must be aged 18 or over on the date of application; and
    2.   (b) the applicant and their fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner must have met in person; and
    3.   (c) the relationship between the applicant and their fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner must be genuine; and
    4.   (d) the applicant and their fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner must not be so closely related that they would be prohibited from marrying, or entering into a civil partnership with, each other as defined in the Marriage Acts 1949 to 1986, the Marriage (Scotland) Act 1977 and 1986, the Marriage (Northern Ireland) Order 2003, the Civil Partnership Act 2004 and the Marriage and Civil Partnership (Scotland) Act 2014; and
    5.   (e) neither the applicant nor their fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner can be married to, or in a civil partnership with, another person at the date of application; and
    6.   (f) the applicant must be seeking entry clearance to enable their marriage or civil partnership to take place in the UK within 6 months of the date of entry to the UK.

1.   AF 13.2. If the application is for permission to stay as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner: 
    1.   (a) the applicant must have been granted entry clearance as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner; and
    2.   (b) the marriage or civil partnership must not have taken place; and
    3.   (c) the decision maker must be satisfied there is a good reason for the delay; and
    4.   (d) the decision maker must be satisfied the marriage or civil partnership will take place in the UK within 6 months of the date of application for permission to stay.
chunks.summary: Applicants seeking entry clearance or permission to stay as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner of an HM Armed Forces member must be over 18, have met in person, and have a genuine relationship. They must not be closely related, already married or in a civil partnership, and intend to marry or form a civil partnership in the UK within six months of entry.

metadata.section_title: Requirements as a child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Requirements as a child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 14.1. The applicant must meet the following requirements for a dependent child in Appendix Children: 
    1.   (a) age requirement; and
    2.   (b) independent life requirement; and
    3.   (c) care requirement; and
    4.   (d) relationship requirement: entry clearance and permission to stay.

metadata.section_title: English language requirement for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### English language requirement for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 15.1. Unless an exemption applies, the applicant must show English language ability on the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages in speaking and listening of at least level A1.

AF 15.2. The applicant must show they meet the English language requirement, or are exempt, as set out in Appendix English Language.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on or after 11 April 2024

chunks.text:
### Financial requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver applying for entry clearance or permission to stay on or after 11 April 2024

1.   AF 16.1. Unless AF 17.1 applies, the applicant must provide specified (where “specified” means as specified in Appendix FM-SE to these Rules) evidence from sources listed in AF 16.3. that: 
    1.   (a) where the applicant is a partner, or where the applicant is a dependent child whose parent is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver, the applicant meets the financial requirement in AF 16.2; or
    2.   (b) where the HM Armed Forces member or HM Armed Forces service leaver, in relation to whom the applicant is applying as a partner or dependent child, is receiving any of the benefits or funds listed in AF 16.4, the applicant’s partner, or in the case of an applicant child, the child’s parents can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any other children in the UK, without recourse to public funds; or
    3.   (c) where the applicant is a child of a member of HM Armed Forces, or an HM Armed Forces service leaver parent, who has sole parental responsibility for them, the parent can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any other children in the UK without recourse to public funds.

1.   AF 16.2. The financial requirement is: 
    1.   (a) a gross annual income of at least £23,496, alone or in combination with
    2.   (b) savings of: 
        1.   (i) £16,000; and
        2.   (ii) additional savings of an amount equivalent to the difference between the gross annual income at AF 16.2. (a), from the sources listed in AF 16.3. (a) to (d), and the total amount required under AF.16.2 (a), multiplied by the length in years of the period of temporary permission to stay for which the applicant has applied (or by the part-year equivalent if the applicant has applied for less than 12 months) from the sources listed in AF 16.3.

1.   AF 16.3. When determining whether the financial requirement in AF 16.2. is met only the following sources will be taken into account: 
    1.   (a) income of the member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver from employment or self-employment, which, in respect of a person returning to the UK with the applicant, can include employment or self-employment overseas and in the UK; or
    2.   (b) (where the applicant is a dependent child) income of the applicant’s parent who is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a dependent partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver from specified employment or self-employment if they are in the UK unless they are working illegally; or
    3.   (c) specified pension income of the applicant and their partner; or
    4.   (d) any specified maternity allowance or bereavement benefit received by the partner in the UK or any specified payment relating to service in HM Armed Forces received by the applicant or their partner; or
    5.   (e) Specified income from the sources at sub-paragraphs (b) and (d) of a dependent child aged 18 or over, of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    6.   (f) specified savings of the member of HM Armed Forces or the HM Armed Forces service leaver, their partner or dependent child aged 18 or over.

1.   AF 16.4. For the purpose of AF 16.1. (b), or AF 17.3. (b), the member of HM Armed Forces, or the HM Armed Forces service leaver, must be in receipt of one of the following: 
    1.   (a) disability living allowance; or 
    2.   (b) severe disablement allowance; or 
    3.   (c) industrial injury disablement benefit; or 
    4.   (d) attendance allowance; or 
    5.   (e) carer’s allowance; or 
    6.   (f) personal independence payment; or 
    7.   (g) DELETED
    8.   (h) Armed Forces Independence Payment or Guaranteed Income Payment under the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme; or
    9.   (i) Constant Attendance Allowance, Mobility Supplement or War Disablement Pension under the War Pensions Scheme; or Police Injury Pension:
    10.   (j) Police Injury Pension; or
    11.   (k) Child Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    12.   (l) Adult Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    13.   (m) Carer’s Support Payment (Scotland); or
    14.   (n) Pension Age Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    15.   (o) Scottish Adult Disability Living Allowance (Scotland).

AF 16.5. The applicant must show they meet the financial requirement as specified in Appendix FM-SE.
chunks.summary: Eligible partners or children of HM Armed Forces members or leavers must provide evidence satisfying financial or maintenance criteria, ensuring they can support themselves without recourse to public funds. The requirements depend on their relationship status, benefits received, and parental responsibilities, with specific thresholds outlined in Appendix FM-SE.

metadata.section_title: Pre-11 April 2024 Transitional financial requirements

chunks.text:
### Pre-11 April 2024 Transitional financial requirements

1.   AF 17.1. An applicant need not meet the requirements in AF 16.1 and instead must provide specified (where “specified” means as specified in Appendix FM-SE to these Rules) evidence from the sources listed in AF 17.5 that they meet the transitional financial requirement at AF 17.3 if: 
    1.   (a) (in the case of dependent partner applications) they have permission as a dependent partner (including as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner) of a member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Services leaver at the date of application, if they made an application for entry clearance or permission as such a partner, before 11 April 2024, which was successful;
    2.   (b) Where the applicant is a dependent child, the parent of the applicant has applied, or is applying for, entry clearance or permission as a dependant partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or and HM Armed Forces service leaver and they meet the requirements of (a) above;
    3.   (c) the application for entry clearance, permission to enter or permission to stay, as a dependent partner or child has been made before 11 April 2024.

AF 17.2. Where the applicant is a partner, AF 17.1(a) only applies if the applicant is applying for permission to stay with the same partner as when they were last granted permission (and if applying for permission with a new partner, the applicant must meet the financial requirement at AF 16.2).

1.   AF 17.3. The applicant must provide specified (where “specified” means as specified in Appendix FM-SE to these Rules) evidence from sources listed in AF 17.5. that: 
    1.   (a) the financial requirement in AF 17.4. is met: or
    2.   (b) where the member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver in relation to whom the applicant is applying as a dependant is receiving any of the benefits or funds listed in AF 16.4., the applicant partner, or in the case of an applicant child, either or both of the child’s parents can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any children in the UK, without recourse to public funds; or
    3.   (c) where the applicant is a child of a member of HM Armed Forces, or an HM Armed Forces service leaver parent, who has sole parental responsibility for them, the parent can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any other children in the UK without recourse to public funds.

1.   AF 17.4. The financial requirement is: 
    1.   (a) a gross annual income of at least: 
        1.   (i) £18,600; and
        2.   (ii) an additional £3,800 for the first child; and
        3.   (iii)an additional £2,400 for each additional child; alone or in combination with

    2.   (b) savings of 
        1.   (i) £16,000; and
        2.   (ii) additional savings or an amount equivalent to the difference between the gross annual income from the sources listed in AF 17.3.(a) to (d) and the total amount required under paragraph AF 17.2 multiplied by the length in years of the period of limited leave for which the applicant has applied (or by the part-year equivalent if the applicant has applied for less than 12 months’ limited leave) - between the gross annual income from the sources listed in paragraph.

1.   AF 17.5. When determining whether the financial requirement in AF 17.3. or AF 17.4. is met only the following sources will be taken into account: 
    1.   (a) income of the member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver from specified employment or self-employment, which, in respect of a person returning to the UK with the applicant, can include specified employment or self-employment overseas and in the UK; or
    2.   (b) the dependant partner applicant’s (or, where the applicant is a dependent child, income of the applicant’s parent who is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a dependent partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver) income from specified employment or self-employment if they are in the UK unless they are working illegally;
    3.   (c) specified pension income of the applicant and partner; or
    4.   (d) any specified maternity allowance or bereavement benefit received by the partner in the UK or any specified payment relating to service in HM Armed Forces received by the applicant or partner; or
    5.   (e) income from the sources at AF 17.6.(b) and (d) of a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s parent who is aged 18 or over; and
    6.   (f) specified savings of the applicant and their partner; or of the applicant’s parent and that parent’s partner; or of a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s parent who is aged 18 or over.

1.   AF 17.6. In AF 17.4. “child” means a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s partner who is: 
    1.   (a) under the age of 18 years, or who was under the age of 18 years when they were first granted entry under this route; and
    2.   (b) applying for entry clearance or leave to remain as a dependant of the applicant or the applicant’s partner, or is in the UK with leave as their dependant; and
    3.   (c) not a British Citizen, settled in the UK, or in the UK with valid limited leave to enter or remain granted under EU3 or EU3A of Appendix EU to these Rules; and
    4.   (d) not an EEA national with a right to be admitted to or reside in the UK under the Immigration (European Economic Area) Regulations 2016.

AF 17.7. Where the financial requirement at AF 16.4. exceeds £23,496 due to the number of children in the family, the applicant will only need to provide evidence of a gross annual income of £23,496.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to dependents of UK Armed Forces personnel or leavers applying before 11 April 2024. It allows them to meet transitional financial requirements by providing specified evidence, provided their applications or permissions were granted before that date. Critical conditions include applications made before 11 April 2024 and specific rules for partners and dependents regarding previous permissions and relationship status.

(b) the dependant partner applicant’s (or, where the applicant is a dependent child, income of the applicant’s parent who is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a dependent partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver) income from specified employment or self-employment if they are in the UK unless they are working illegally;
    3.   (c) specified pension income of the applicant and partner; or
    4.   (d) any specified maternity allowance or bereavement benefit received by the partner in the UK or any specified payment relating to service in HM Armed Forces received by the applicant or partner; or
    5.   (e) income from the sources at AF 17.6.(b) and (d) of a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s parent who is aged 18 or over; and
    6.   (f) specified savings of the applicant and their partner; or of the applicant’s parent and that parent’s partner; or of a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s parent who is aged 18 or over.

1.   AF 17.6. In AF 17.4. “child” means a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s partner who is: 
    1.   (a) under the age of 18 years, or who was under the age of 18 years when they were first granted entry under this route; and
    2.   (b) applying for entry clearance or leave to remain as a dependant of the applicant or the applicant’s partner, or is in the UK with leave as their dependant; and
    3.   (c) not a British Citizen, settled in the UK, or in the UK with valid limited leave to enter or remain granted under EU3 or EU3A of Appendix EU to these Rules; and
    4.   (d) not an EEA national with a right to be admitted to or reside in the UK under the Immigration (European Economic Area) Regulations 2016.

AF 17.7. Where the financial requirement at AF 16.4. exceeds £23,496 due to the number of children in the family, the applicant will only need to provide evidence of a gross annual income of £23,496.

metadata.section_title: Eligibility requirement for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an Armed Forces service leaver relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights.

chunks.text:
### Eligibility requirement for entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an Armed Forces service leaver relying on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights.

AF 19.1. Where the applicant does not meet all the suitability requirements or eligibility requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an Armed Forces service leaver, the decision maker must be satisfied that refusal of the application would breach Article 8 of the Human Rights Convention because it would result in unjustifiably harsh consequences for the applicant or their family.

AF 19.2. Where AF 19.1. applies, and the applicant falls for refusal under SUI 2.1., SUI 2.3., SUI 4.1., SUI 5.1., of Part Suitability, the application as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an Armed Forces Service leaver, will be refused.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners or children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers seeking entry clearance or permission to stay. The decision hinges on whether refusal would breach Article 8, considering harsh consequences, except if the applicant fails suitability or eligibility criteria. Critical conditions include specific suitability thresholds and the necessity to assess human rights impacts.

metadata.section_title: Period and conditions of grant for entry clearance or permission to stay for partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Period and conditions of grant for entry clearance or permission to stay for partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 21.1. Entry clearance or permission to stay as a partner will be granted for whichever is shorter of: 
    1.   (a) 5 years; or
    2.   (b) the remaining duration of the applicant’s partner’s enlistment; or
    3.   (c) the remaining duration of the applicant’s partner’s extant permission; or
    4.   (d) 6 months if the applicant is being granted entry clearance or permission to stay as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner.

AF 21.2. Entry clearance or permission to stay as a dependent child will be granted to end on the same date as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first, unless one parent is a British citizen or a person who has a right to enter or stay in the UK without restriction and is, or will be, ordinarily resident in the UK, in such case, the applicant will be granted permission to stay which ends on the same date as the parent who is granted as the partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver.

1.   AF 21.3. The grant will be subject to the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work permitted (including self-employment and voluntary work) (unless granted as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner where no work is permitted); and
    3.   (c) study permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS (unless granted as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner where no study is permitted).
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and dependent children of HM Armed Forces members and service leavers. Grants are valid for up to 5 years or the partner’s/enlistment’s duration, with dependent permissions ending when their parent’s ends, subject to exceptions. Conditions include no access to public funds, permitted work, and study rights, with specific restrictions for fiancé(e)s and proposed civil partners.

1.   AF 21.3. The grant will be subject to the following conditions:

metadata.section_title: Validity requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Validity requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 22.1. If applying from outside the UK, a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver must apply online on the gov.uk website on the specified form: “VAF: AF”.

AF 22.2. If applying from in the UK, a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver must apply for settlement on the gov.uk website on the specified form: “SET: Armed Forces”.

1.   AF 22.3. An application for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver must meet all the following requirements: 
    1.   (a) any fee must have been paid; and
    2.   (b) the applicant must have provided biometrics when required; and
    3.   (c) the applicant must have provided a passport or other document that satisfactorily establishes their identity and nationality.

AF 22.4. An application which does not meet all the validity requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver may be rejected as invalid and not considered.
chunks.summary: Applicants—partners or children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers—must apply online using specific forms depending on their location, and ensure they pay fees, provide biometrics, and submit valid identity documents. Applications failing to meet these criteria will be rejected as invalid.

chunks.text:
### Suitability requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 23.1. The decision maker must be satisfied that the applicant should not be refused under Part Suitability.

1.   AF 23.2. If the applicant is in the UK on the date of application, they must not be: 
    1.   (a) in breach of immigration laws, except that where the Exceptions for overstayers section of Part Suitability applies, that period of overstaying will be disregarded; or
    2.   (b) on immigration bail

It requires applicants to meet suitability criteria, including not being in breach of immigration laws (except where overstaying is disregarded) or on immigration bail. The decision hinges on satisfying suitability requirements under Part Suitability.

chunks.text:
### Entry requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 24.1. If applying from outside the UK as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver the applicant must apply for and obtain entry clearance for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver before they arrive in the UK.

AF 24.2. If Appendix Tuberculosis applies, the applicant must provide a valid medical certificate confirming that they have undergone screening for active pulmonary tuberculosis and that this tuberculosis is not present in them.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers applying from outside the UK. They must obtain entry clearance for settlement before arrival, and if Tuberculosis screening applies, they must provide a valid medical certificate confirming they are not affected.

metadata.section_title: Relationship requirements for settlement as a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Relationship requirements for settlement as a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 25.1. The applicant must be the partner of a person where one of the following apply: 
    1.   (a) is a member of HM Armed Forces exempt from immigration control with at least 5 years’ reckonable service; or
    2.   (b) has been granted or, is at the same time applying for (and is being granted) settlement as a HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    3.   (c) has permission granted under this Appendix or the previous Appendix Armed Forces; or
    4.   (d) is a British citizen, including one who naturalised after 5 years reckonable service, who is a member of HM Armed Forces or is an HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    5.   (e) is settled providing the person had permission (or exemption from control) as a member of HM Armed Forces or as an HM Armed Forces service leaver before they were granted settlement.

AF 25.2. The requirements of Appendix Relationship with Partner must be met.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to applicants seeking settlement as partners of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers. The applicant must demonstrate a genuine partnership with someone who meets specific criteria, such as at least 5 years’ service, being a service leaver, or holding British or settled status, with certain conditions regarding prior permission or exemption. Compatibility with the Appendix Relationship with Partner is also required.

    1.   (a) age requirement; and
    2.   (b) independent life requirement; and
    3.   (c) care requirement; and
    4.   (d) relationship requirement: settlement.

metadata.section_title: Qualifying period for settlement as partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Qualifying period for settlement as partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 27.1. The applicant must have completed a continuous period of 60 months with permission under this Appendix, or previous Appendix Armed Forces, as the partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver (excluding any period of entry clearance or permission to stay as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner).

1.   AF 27.2. If the applicant does not meet AF 27.1, the qualifying period of 60 months can be met by including periods of time spent with continuous residence on any other route to settlement, if the applicant: 
    1.   (a) did not enter the UK illegally; and
    2.   (b) has permission as a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver for at least one year immediately before the date of application.

AF 27.3. If the applicant is a child, they can have completed a period of less than 60 months if their parent meets AF 27.1. and is being granted settlement under this Appendix at the same time.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers seeking settlement. They must have completed a 60-month continuous permission period under this appendix or its predecessor, excluding entry as a fiancé(e). Alternatively, a shorter period may suffice if they have prior UK residence of at least one year as a partner and have not entered illegally; children’s qualifying time depends on their parent’s eligibility.

### Continuous residence requirement for settlement as partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 28.1. The applicant must meet the continuous residence requirement as set out in Appendix Continuous Residence for the qualifying period.

Summary: Applicants seeking settlement as a partner or child of HM Armed Forces personnel or service leavers must satisfy the continuous residence requirement specified in Appendix Continuous Residence during the qualifying period, with no explicit exceptions outlined.

### Continuous residence requirement for settlement as partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 28.1. The applicant must meet the continuous residence requirement as set out in Appendix Continuous Residence for the qualifying period.

metadata.section_title: Financial requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Financial requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 31.1. Unless AF 32.1. applies, the applicant must provide specified (where “specified” means as specified in Appendix FM-SE to these Rules) evidence from sources listed in AF 31.3. that: 
    1.   (a) where the applicant is a partner, or where the applicant is a dependent child whose parent is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver, the applicant meets the financial requirement in AF 31.2.; or
    2.   (b) where the HM Armed Forces member or HM Armed Forces service leaver in relation to whom the applicant is applying as a partner or dependent child is receiving any of the benefits or funds listed in AF 31.4., the applicant’s partner, or in the case of an applicant child, the child’s parents, can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any other children in the UK, without recourse to public funds; or
    3.   (c) where the applicant is a child of a member of HM Armed Forces, or an HM Armed Forces service leaver, parent who has sole parental responsibility for them, the parent can adequately maintain themselves, the applicant and any other children in the UK without recourse to public funds.

1.   AF 31.2. The financial requirement is: 
    1.   (a) a gross annual income of at least £23,496, alone or in combination with
    2.   (b) savings of 
        1.   (i) £16,000; and
        2.   (ii) additional savings of an amount equivalent to the amount which is the difference between the gross annual income at AF 31.2 (a), from the sources listed in AF 31.3. (a) to (d), and the total amount required under AF 31.2 (a); or

    3.   (c) the requirements in AF 31.4. being met.

1.   AF 31.3. When determining whether the financial requirement in AF 31.2 is met only the following sources will be taken into account: 
    1.   (a) income of the member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver in the UK with permission to work , which, in respect of a person returning to the UK with the applicant, can include employment or self-employment overseas and in the UK; or
    2.   (b) the dependant partner applicant’s (or, where the applicant is a dependent child, income of the applicant’s parent who is also applying for or has entry clearance or permission as a dependent partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver) income from specified employment or self-employment if they are in the UK unless they are working illegally; or
    3.   (c) pension income of the applicant and their partner; or
    4.   (d) any maternity allowance or bereavement benefit received by the partner in the UK or any specified payment relating to service in HM Armed Forces received by the applicant or their partner; or
    5.   (e) income from the sources at sub-paragraphs (b) and (d) of a dependent child aged 18 or over, of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver; or
    6.   (f) savings of the applicant and partner, or child where the child is over 18 at the date of application.

1.   AF 31.4. For the purpose of AF 31.2. (c), or AF 32.3 (c), the member of HM Armed Forces, or the HM Armed Forces service leaver, must be in receipt of one of the following: 
    1.   (a) disability living allowance; or
    2.   (b) severe disablement allowance; or
    3.   (c) industrial injury disablement benefit; or
    4.   (d) attendance allowance; or
    5.   (e) carer’s allowance; or
    6.   (f) personal independence payment; or
    7.   (g) DELETED
    8.   (h) Armed Forces Independence Payment or Guaranteed Income Payment under the Armed Forces Compensation Scheme; or
    9.   (i) Constant Attendance Allowance, Mobility Supplement or War Disablement Pension under the War Pensions Scheme; or Police Injury Pension:
    10.   (j) Police Injury Pension; or
    11.   (k) Child Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    12.   (l) Adult Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    13.   (m) Carer’s Support Payment (Scotland); or
    14.   (n) Pension Age Disability Payment (Scotland); or
    15.   (o) Scottish Adult Disability Living Allowance (Scotland).

AF 31.5. The applicant must show they meet the financial requirement as specified in Appendix FM-SE.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers seeking settlement. Applicants must meet specific financial requirements, either by demonstrating an income of at least £23,496 or by showing adequate maintenance without recourse to public funds, particularly if the Armed Forces member receives certain benefits. Critical conditions include parental sole responsibility and exceptions where AF 32.1. applies.

metadata.section_title: Transitional financial requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Transitional financial requirements for a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

1.   AF 32.1. An applicant need not meet the requirements in AF 31.1. and instead must provide specified evidence from the sources listed in AF 31.3 that they meet the transitional financial requirement at AF 32.3. if: 
    1.   (a) (in the case of dependant partner applications) they have permission as a dependant partner (including as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner) of a member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Services leaver at the date of application if they made an application for entry clearance or permission as such a partner before 11 April 2024, which was successful (and that application did not rely on Article 8 of the European Convention on Human Rights following consideration of AF 19.1); or
    2.   (b) Where the applicant is a dependent child, the parent of the applicant has applied, or is applying for, entry clearance or permission as a dependant partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver and meets the requirements of (a) above; or
    3.   (c) the application for settlement has been made before 11 April 2024.

AF 32.2. Where the applicant is a partner, AF 32.1(a) only applies if the applicant is applying for settlement with the same partner as when they were last granted permission (and if applying for settlement with a new partner, the applicant must meet the financial requirement at AF 31.2.).

1.   AF 32.3. The financial requirement is: 
    1.   (a) a gross annual income of at least: 
        1.   (i) £18,600;
        2.   (ii) an additional £3,800 for the first child; and
        3.   (iii)an additional £2,400 for each additional child; alone or in combination with:

    2.   (b) specified savings of: 
        1.   (i) £16,000; and
        2.   (ii) additional savings or an amount equivalent to the amount which is the difference between the gross annual income from the sources listed in AF 30.3.(a) to (d) and the total amount required under AF 31.3(a).; or

    3.   (c) £23,496, where the requirements of AF 32.4. are met.

AF 32.4. Where the financial requirement at AF 32.3.(a) exceeds £23,496 due to the number of children in the family, the applicant will only need to provide evidence of a gross annual income of £23,496.

1.   AF 32.5. In AF 32.3. “child” means a dependent child of the applicant or the applicant’s partner who is: 
    1.   (a) under the age of 18 years, or who was under the age of 18 years when they were first granted entry under this route; and
    2.   (b) applying for entry clearance or leave to remain as a dependant of the applicant or the applicant’s partner, or is in the UK with leave as their dependant; and
    3.   (c) not a British Citizen, settled in the UK, or in the UK with valid limited leave to enter or remain granted under EU3 or EU3A of Appendix EU to these Rules; and
    4.   (d) not an EEA national with a right to be admitted to or reside in the UK under the Immigration (European Economic Area) Regulations 2016.
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners and children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers applying for settlement. They must meet specific transitional financial requirements if their application was made before 11 April 2024 or if their previous permission was granted before this date. Critical conditions include applying with the same partner or prior approval, with exceptions for new partners meeting standard financial criteria.

metadata.section_title: Decision on an application for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

chunks.text:
### Decision on an application for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver

AF 33.1. If the decision maker is satisfied that all the suitability and eligibility requirements for settlement as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or an HM Armed Forces service leaver are met, the applicant will be granted entry clearance for settlement (where the applicant is outside the UK) or settlement.

AF 33.2. If the requirements for settlement are not met, but the decision maker believes the applicant is likely to meet the requirements for permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver under this Appendix, the application will be varied by the Secretary of State to an application for permission to stay as a partner or child of a member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces Service leaver. Where this happens no additional application fee for entry clearance or permission to stay will be required and the settlement application fee will not be refunded.

1.   AF 33.3. Where AF 33.2. applies, and the outcome of the consideration is to grant permission to stay as a partner, it will be for whichever is shorter of: 
    1.   (a) 5 years; or
    2.   (b) the remaining duration of the applicant’s partners enlistment; or
    3.   (c) the remaining duration of the applicant’s partners extant permission or
    4.   (d) 6 months if the applicant is being granted entry clearance, permission to enter or stay as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner.

AF 33.4. Where AF 33.2. applies, permission to stay as a child will be granted to end on the same day as whichever of their parents’ permission ends first unless the other parent is a British citizen who has a right to enter or stay in the UK without restriction and is, or will be, ordinarily resident in the UK, in which case the applicant will be granted permission which ends on the same date as the parent who is granted as the partner of a member of HM Armed Forces or HM Armed Forces service leaver.

1.   AF 33.5. The grant under AF 33.2. will be subject to the following conditions: 
    1.   (a) no access to public funds; and
    2.   (b) work permitted (including self-employment and voluntary work) (unless granted as a fiancé(e) or proposed civil partner in which case work is permitted); and
    3.   (c) study permitted, subject to the ATAS condition in Appendix ATAS (unless granted as a fiancé or proposed civil partner in which case no study is allowed).

AF 33.6. If the decision maker is not satisfied that the applicant meets the requirements for settlement or permission to stay, the application for settlement will be refused.

Print this page
chunks.summary: This provision applies to partners or children of HM Armed Forces members or service leavers seeking settlement. It requires them to meet suitability and eligibility criteria for settlement; if unmet but likely to be met, their application may be varied to permission to stay, with grants limited to up to 5 years or the relevant enlistment or permission duration. No additional fees are charged when varied, and grants may be shorter if conditions change.
